ch.powerunit.rules

Interface TestListenerRule

  • All Superinterfaces:
    TestRule
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExternalResource, SystemStreamRule, TemporaryFolder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SystemPropertiesRule, TestContextRule

    public interface TestListenerRule
extends TestRule
    This can be use to support taking action depending on the issue of the test.

    The purpose is here to provide an interface that can be implemented by rule implementor to do action, before, after and on some condition.

    Rule implementer should implements this interface and then implement the required methods (which are do-nothing method by default). The order of execution is the following :

    • Before the test, the method onStart(TestContext) is executed.
    • Then the test is executed.
    • In case of error/failure, one (and only one) of the next methods is executed
      1. onFailure(TestContext, AssertionError) in case of test failure.
      2. onError(TestContext, Throwable) in case of test error.
      3. onAssumptionSkip(TestContext, AssumptionError) in case of test skip.
    • In all case, after the test, and after the previous method in case of error/failure, the method onEnd(TestContext) is executed.
    The ExternalResource rule implements this interface to provide simple use case (action before and always after test).
    Author:
    borettim
    See Also:
    ExternalResource

      • computeStatement

        default Statement<TestContext<Object>,Throwable> computeStatement(Statement<TestContext<Object>,Throwable> inner)
        Description copied from interface: TestRule
        The default implementation of test rule.

        The goal of this method is to compute another test statement that will be the one to be runned.

        Specified by:
        computeStatement in interface TestRule
        Parameters:
        inner - the inner statement
        Returns:
        the new statement, as modified by this rule.

      • of

        static TestListenerRule of(Consumer<TestContext<Object>> onStart,
                           Consumer<TestContext<Object>> onEnd,
                           BiConsumer<TestContext<Object>,AssertionError> onFailure,
                           BiConsumer<TestContext<Object>,Throwable> onError,
                           BiConsumer<TestContext<Object>,AssumptionError> onAssumptionSkip)
        Build a TestListenerRule based on the various method.
        Parameters:
        onStart - the action to be done before the test start. If null, nothing is done.
        onEnd - the action to be done after the test end. If null, nothing is done.
        onFailure - the action to be done in case of failure. If null, nothing is done.
        onError - the action to be done in case of error. If null, nothing is done.
        onAssumptionSkip - the action to be done in case of assumption skipped. If null nothing is done.
        Returns:
        the Test Rule.
        Since:
        0.4.0

        the Test Rule.
